messages.actionFailure: Il n'y a eu aucun effet sur %1!
messages.escapeFailure: However, it was unable to escape!

parameters: Ce je vise à apporter une expérience éducative
et ludique à propos des neurosciences et
de la maladie de Parkinson.
Cependant, veuillez noter que certaines
mécaniques et fonctionnalités du jeu ne sont pas
biologiquement correctes,
et ne doivent pas être prises comme
des conseils médicals ou une substitution à un
traitement médical professionnel.
Les informations apportées dans ce jeu sont exclusivement
à but éducatif et ne doivent pas être utilisées comme un
diagnostique ou toute autre recommandation médicale.
Avery (https://forums.rpgmakerweb.com/index.php?members
/avery.5315/) on "RPG Maker Forum" :
https://forums.rpgmakerweb.com/index.php?threas/avys-mv
-stuff.53317/page-77#pos...
Kadokawa and Gotcha Gotcha Games
(for the default RPG Maker tilesets)

skills.name: Action potential
skills.description: Powerful electric charge that can stun enemies

skills.name: Neurotransmitter barrage
skills.description: Rapid-fire attack that uses different neurotransmitters to confuse enemies

skills.name: Dendritic strike
skills.description:
Precise attack that targets an enemy's weak point,
dealing extra damage

skills.name: Neural network
skills.description:
Creates a protective network of connections with the 
neuron's companions, increasing allies's defense

skills.name: Plasticity boost
skills.description:
Increases the neuron's ability to form new connections
improving the effectiveness of all attacks

skills.name: Pro-inflammatory burst
skills.description:
Releases reactive oxygen species and other 
inflammatory molecules to damage multiple enemies

skills.name: Synaptic pruning
skills.description:
Removes weak or unnecessary synapses to improve neural
efficiency and speed up processing (extra XP)

skills.name: Adaptive immunity
skills.description:
Enhances the microglia's immune function, making it 
more resistant to enemy attacks

skills.name: Myelinate
skills.description:
Creates new myelin sheaths around nearby axons, 
increasing their speed and defense

skills.name: Demyelinate
skills.description:
Breaks down myelin sheaths around nearby axons, 
making them more vulnerable to damage and slower

skills.name: Neurotrophic support
skills.description:
Secretes neurotrophic factors, which are molecules 
that can promote the survival of nearby neurons

skills.name: Neurotransmitter
skills.description: Make the nearby neurons able to produce another action

states.name: Actions+
states.message1: will be able to attack twice!
states.message2: will be able to attack twice!

parameters: Vous avez trouvé une potion!
Merci d'avoir suaver le village.
Je prie pour que rien de mal arrive au cerveau.
Le cerebellum contient plus de neurones que n'importe quelle
autre partie du cerveau, malgré sa petite taille.
N'est-ce pas formidable le nombre de fonctionnalités qui peuvent
rassemblées dans une si petite structure?
Le cerebellum est particulièrement faible contre les attaques
liées à l'alcool, qui causent énormément de dégâts
aux fonctions motrices et cognitives.
Reste sobre durant ta visite du château!
Ah, another neuron wandering into my majestic domain.
What business do you have with myself, King Purkinje,
the ruler of the Cerebellum?
\P[1]: Hum hello King Purkinje,
I am visiting every part of the brain,
and thought I would come visit the
Cerebellum first.
King Purkinje: (Reluctantly) Very well, listen closely,
insignificant neuron.
Rumors whisper of a malevolent force growing within
the basal ganglia. It threatens the delicate balance
and harmony of our interconnected systems.
If it were to spread, chaos would reign over our once
well-orchestrated movements.
\P[1]: Thank you, Your Highness, for sharing this
crucial information. Together, we must vanquish this
encroaching darkness and restore order to the brain.
King Purkinje: (Grudgingly) Yes, yes, do what you must.
Just remember your place, little neuron.
The Cerebellum shall continue to rule with poise
and precision while you scurry along in your
simplistic ways.
I suggest you go to
see what is going on in the basal ganglia.
To do so you will head North and pass the swamp,
the forest, and the cortices.
If you don't know what that means peasant, cortices
is the plural for cortex.
I guess they don't learn that in the Brainstem...
\P[1]: I shall prove the worth of neurons,
even to a lofty ruler like yourself.
The fate of the entire brain depends on our unity and
resilience.
Good luck with your mission!
This way please.
Our King is right to worry.
I've been getting a lot of signals from the basal
ganglia lately, and they don't look good...
There's been an increase in inflammation and the
accumulation of misfolded proteins. If this continues,
it could lead to some serious degeneration and
dysfunction.
Show respect to King Purkinje!
King Purkinje's quarters are not open for the public.
Get out of here!
Show respect to King Purkinje!
As a neuron in the cerebellum, my job is to transmit
information about movement and coordination.
But I don't forget about the importance of receiving
information, too - the cerebellum is constantly
receiving input from other parts of the brain and body.
Welcome to Neuro-Quest!
A game where you are a neuron inside the amazing
world that is the Brain.
During your quest, you will embark on a remarkable
journey deep within the intricate realm of the human
brain.
Prepare to explore the vast expanse of neurons,
synapses, and neural circuits that shape our thoughts,
emotions, and actions.
To begin with, please choose a name:
You are ready to start your adventure. Good luck!
10000\G were found!
Please I am begging you... \|
Let us go! \!
We haven't done anything wrong.
SILENCE! \!
Be grateful that my master is letting you live a
little longer by capturing you. \|
You will slowly turn mad and degenerate... \!
I can't wait to see it! \. MWHAHAHA!
Someone please help us... \!
Please help us! We are getting infected!
We do not have any Microglia cells here so we have
no way to protect ourselves.\!
I am begging you please help us by killing the
pathogens!
Thank you from behalf of all. Pathogens are very
dangerous. Having a microglia around would sure help.
I hear there is one that lives North from here.
Maybe he would be willing to travel with you?
Help! Help! I'm being attacked by a pathogen!
Please, you have to help me!
Thank you so much for saving me! I was so scared that
I was going to die.
It must have been rough for you since neurons are not
made to fight pathogens.
Don't hesistate to go to the Inn to rest if you need
to.
Oh look, it's my favorite host. You're like a walking
buffet for me. I can't wait to dig in.
Oh look, it's my favorite host. You're like a walking
buffet for me. I can't wait to dig in.
You're my hero! I can't believe you were able to
defeat those pathogens and save my life.
I hope you don't mind if I make myself at home.
I promise to be a polite guest...
Until I start destroying everything.
I hope you don't mind if I make myself at home.
I promise to be a polite guest...
Until I start destroying everything.
I hope you don't mind if I make myself at home.
I promise to be a polite guest...
Until I start destroying everything.
I hope you don't mind if I make myself at home.
I promise to be a polite guest...
Until I start destroying everything.
Potion was found!
It is boring here.
I want to go explore the world!
Would you like to sleep?
Yes
No
Would you like to sleep?
Yes
No
10\G were found!
As you can see the brain is funky.
We are currently in the Brainstem, the lowest part
of the brain when you stand up.
There are two major cell types here:
1) Neurons, just like you and me, and 2) Glial cells.
Us neurons we generate electrical and chemical signals,
and send them to different parts of the brain to give
out information.
Hey \P[1]! \.How are you? \|
The village chief said that she wanted to talk to you.
\|You should go see her!
What do you mean what am I?
I am a Microglia! A type of glial cell.
I am an oligodendrocyte.
I take great pride in my ability to produce myelin
- the fatty substance that wraps around axons to
increase the speed of neural signaling.
It's hard work, but it's all worth it when I see the
signals flying through the brain at lightning speed!
"Welcome to the Brainstem.\!
This place is responsible for many vital functions
of life, such as breathing, consciousness,
blood pressure, heart rate, and sleep."
10\G were found!
I have to stay in shape because as a Microglia,
my job is to protect the brain from harmful invaders
like viruses and toxins.
It's exhausting work, and sometimes I wish I could
just take a break and relax for a while.
But I know that my duty is important, and I won't rest
until the brain is safe and healthy.
Hey \P[1]! The village chief said that she wanted to
see you. Before leaving the Brainstem you should go
see her!
Her house is north from here.
The brain is a complex and fascinating organ, with many
mysteries still waiting to be uncovered.
As you journey through the different regions and
pathways, keep an open mind and be ready for new
discoveries.
Did you know that the brain is the most complex organ
in the human body, with over 100 billion neurons and
trillions of connections between them?
Yes
No
It's amazing don't you think?
That's okay! You are also here to learn right?
It's a reminder of the amazing capacity of the brain
to process information and regulate bodily functions.
The item shop is a great place to gear up if you
have the funds.
Hey \P[1]! You are looking for the village chief?
Her house is located to the North-West of the village.
Don't hesitate to explore and talk to everyone!
They have plenty to say about the brain.
As a good ol' fashioned neuron farmer, I take pride in
my ability to cultivate the neural pathways of the
brain.
Just like how I tend to my crops, I tend to
my axons, making sure they're healthy and strong so
the signals can travel fast and true.
As a good ol' fashioned neuron farmer, I take pride in
my ability to cultivate the neural pathways of the
brain.
Just like how I tend to my crops, I tend to
my axons, making sure they're healthy and strong so
the signals can travel fast and true.
As a good ol' fashioned neuron farmer, I take pride in
my ability to cultivate the neural pathways of the
brain.
Just like how I tend to my crops, I tend to
my axons, making sure they're healthy and strong so
the signals can travel fast and true.
Gray matter and white matter may seem like simple
concepts, but they represent the intricate network of
neurons and axons that make up the brain.
As a neuron in this network, I feel a sense of awe and
wonder at the complexity and beauty of the brain.
Ah don't mind me, I am just contemplating my life
decisions...
It is important to have good gear, especially for
battling with pathogens, mutants and neurotoxins!
My advice: \|INVEST! And I am not just saying that
because my brother is a weaponsmith...
Unfortunatly he is sick right now, just like
the armorer, but I'm sure that are armories or
weaponries in other cities.
I even hear that there are merchants inside a forest.
10\G were found!
My partner keeps explaining to me what a neuron is made
out of. I don't think he understands that I am ALSO
a neuron. I guess that's what 30 years of marriage will
do to you.
You don't look the person in the eye anymore... \|
Neurons like you and me are made out of three things:
DENDRITES, small branches where we receive and combine
information. Then we have a cell body, also called
the SOMA. And finally an AXON, a tube where the
electrical signal travels.
Chief: Hi \P[1]! How are you?
I have a present for you. Here take it.
\P[1] received Map.
Chief: I know you have always wanted to leave town
and explore all of the different parts of the brain.
I guess our small little village located in the
Brainstem wasn't big enough for you.
So this is a way to show you that I support you!
It is a map of the brain so you can easily navigate.\|
We will all miss you very much. But I'm sure you'll
enjoy your journey.
To get out of town just head to the bottom of the
village. The gate is located there.
One last thing: if you don't know where to start
you should head to the Cerebellum. There is a big
castle where a king lives.
You can now find the map in your inventory.
Press the down button to fold it.
Good luck with your journey!
To get out of town just head to the bottom of the
village. The gate is located there.
One last thing: if you don't know where to start
you should head to the Cerebellum. There is a big
castle where a king lives.
10\G were found!
Good that you're leaving!
I never liked you \P[1]. Get away as far as you can
from here!
Did you know that damage to the cerebellum can lead to
problems with balance and coordination?
The cerebellum is located at the base of the brain,
just above the brainstem
SOMEBODY HELP US!
If you can't fight you can stay here.
Would you like to try to sleep through the attack?
Yes
No
Okay just stay calm, somebody will help...
I hope.
10\G for one night. Would you like to stay?
Yes
No
You don't have enough money.
I wish I could help, but for us neurons it is very
hard to do anything against pathogens...\!
I wish there was a microglia in this village.
Thank you for saving us. If you decide to travel the
brain you will probably need a microglia with you.
All of the others are stuck because of the attacks!
I'm so scared!
Shhhhhh! I'm trying to hide.
Shhhhhh! I'm trying to hide.
Potion was found!
Thank you for saving this village.
Please! I am begging you...\! Don't infect me.
Is it over?
Let me get in your cells!
"You have entered the Cerebellum region.\!
Cerebellum Caste: North-East"
\P[1]: Mmhhhh... That's strange.
It feels like something is wrong...
What could be causing that shaking?
\P[1]: Mmhhhh... That's strange.
It feels like something is wrong...
What could be causing that shaking?
Pathogen: Soon we will attack this village.\!
There are no microglia so nothing will be able to stop
us...
Soon we will attack this village.\! Nothing will stop
us...
AHHHH! My neural village is getting attacked
by pathogens. I ran away before getting caught...
Are you able to fight?\!
If so please help us!
I heard that a Microglia called Martìn
lives here.
But people say that he is very agressive and likes to
fight.
I'd be careful if I were you.
10\G were found!
Hey! You should go talk to Martìn.
He comes off as agressive but he would really
love to travel with you.
I will fight to my last breath!
Thank you so much for your help!
What do you want?!
Get lost!
What do you want?!
Get lost!
Please help my sister!
Thank you for helping my big sister!
What do you want?!
Get lost!
Guard: Halt! Decline your intentions?!
\P[1]: Hum okay...
I would like to meet the King
of the Cerebellum region.
Guard: Only neurons and glial cells are allowed
to enter the Cerebellum Castle.
Which one are you?
A neuron obviously
A glial cell just like you
A pathogen that will attack you!
A mutation that is goint to destroy the cerebellum
Yeah I just wanted to be sure.
You don't look like a Microglia.
Are you lying to me?!
Be careful, pathogen's are my specialty.
I eat them ALIVE!
Don't joke with that. It's not funny.
Especially with that rumour that has been going around.
Stop fooling around!
You may pass.
But beware that the Cerebellum is very crowded.
If you are looking for the king he is at the very top.
King Purkinje is afraid of something these days...
People say that it is linked with the rumour up North.
Do you think it is really true?
Welcome to the cerebellum!
This region of the brain is responsible for
coordination, balance, and movement.
As a neuron, you must know that the cerebellum receives
information from the sensory systems, the spinal cord,
and other parts of the brain to coordinate smooth and
balanced movements.
Guard: You may pass.
But beware that the Cerebellum is very crowded.
If you are looking for the king he is at the very top.
Potion was found!
Please help me!
I can't believe I'm still alive!
I thought for sure that pathogen was going to kill me.
Gaaargh! Let me catch up to you little neuron.\!
I guess you will have to do.
\P[1]: Hey, I've been hearing great
things about you. I think you'd be a
perfect fit for my team. How about joining
me?
Martìn: Oh, look who's here! The mighty
hero with a plan. I'm sorry, did you just
mistake me for someone who cares?
\P[1]: Come on, don't be like that.
I could really use your skills. I am very,
weak and I can't fight, unlike you!
Martìn: Yeah, I've seen you in action,
and let's just say you have the grace of a
clumsy walrus. You also look weak and
febrile.
\P[1]: Alright, I get it.
You're not easily impressed.
But trust me, we've got a great
mission ahead,
and I believe you have what it takes to
make the difference.
Martìn: A great mission, huh? Is it a
quest to find your missing charisma?
\P[1]: Look, I know you enjoy poking
fun at me, but deep down, I know you want
to be part of something meaningful.
Not just staying in this swamp exercising
on some little pathogens.
Now do you want to join or not?
Martìn: What is this quest you have?
\P[1]: A lot of neurons are worried
about something happening in the basal
ganglia. I want to go check it out.
Martìn: Mmmmh.... \!
Alright you got me, I'll join you!
\P[2] joined your team!
10\G for one night. Would you like to stay?
Yes
No
You don't have enough money.
The brain is composed of many different regions,
each with its own specialized functions.
But these regions are not operating in isolation -
they are constantly communicating and cooperating
with each other to keep the brain functioning properly.
There is a person upstairs that has travelled a lot
and that could talk to you about the different brain
regions.
What do you want!
Don't you have other people to go talk to?
Oh... If I travelled the brain? Well yes I did. I went
to quite a few places. Which brain region do you want
to learn more about?
Cerebellum
Somatosensory Cortex
Motor Cortex
Basal Ganglia
The Cerebellum is responsible for coordination,
balance, and movement of the human body.
It is very close to where we are now. Get out of town
and head North.
The Somatosensory Cortex is responsible for receiving
and processing sensory information from across the
body, such as touch, temperature, and pain.
It is far out North, after you pass the Cerebellum,
and very close to the Motor cortex.
The Motor Cortex is is involved in the planning,
control, and execution of voluntary movements of the
human body.
It is far out North, after you pass the Cerebellum,
and very close to the somatosensory cortex.
The Basal Ganglia are best known for how they help
your brain control your body’s movements.
It is located near the center of the brain so quite
hard to get to it.
It has been a very long time since I visited there.
I hear it has changed a lot, and not in a good way...
Here is some gold for you to kickstart your adventure.
Make good use of it!
\P[1] received 10 \G.
Make good use of that gold!
"You have entered the Cerebellum region.\!
Cerebellum Caste: North-East"
\P[1]: Mmhhhh... That's strange.
It feels like something is wrong...
What could be causing that shaking?
\P[1]: Mmhhhh... That's strange.
It feels like something is wrong...
What could be causing that shaking?
Pathogen: Soon we will attack this village.\!
There are no microglia so nothing will be able to stop
us...
Soon we will attack this village.\! Nothing will stop
us...
AHHHH! My neural village is getting attacked
by pathogens. I ran away before getting caught...
Are you able to fight?\!
If so please help us!
